description.en-US:
Would you please take a few minutes to give us your feedback about CLC here? We‚Äôd love to hear about your experience and learn how we can make CLC even better. When you provide feedback, your name will be entered for a chance to win a $50 Amazon gift card!

[Click here for 2021 Post-Conference Survey](https://watermark.formstack.com/forms/clc2021attendeefeedback)

Young adults are the greatest potential asset for strengthening churches and reaching our communities for Christ. That's why we're giving every church that attended CLC access to our lowest rate for the AWAKEN Conference, September 4-6, 2021 in Dallas, Texas. At AWAKEN, we'll seek to encourage and unleash young adults to go back and change the world for Christ through the local church. Give any young adult you know promo code "CLC2021" to get a ticket for only $79 (offer expires May 31, 2021).

Register now at [awaken.live](http://awaken.live/ "Awaken Conference")

summary.en-US: We get it. It‚Äôs a lot to take in.

description.en-US: We get it. It‚Äôs a lot to take in. All the conference resources (main stage, breakouts, handouts, etc.) will be sent by June 1, so watch your inbox!
Available now on [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/playlist/7aSbfZqEEooCGDgF2fdXWt?si=kuOxBU1AQkCYKiW1fAmr7Q)!

We are making our staff members from every ministry area available to you. That includes our senior leaders, finance coordinators, IT team, student directors, and everything in between! We don't claim to have all the answers, but if you want to hear a different perspective, bounce some ideas off someone else, or hear what's worked (and what hasn't worked) in our experience, sign up for a time slot.

__Registration has closed.__

[Students showcase](clc://clc/app-link/NodeSingle?nodeId=Event:e2b1df1b98bda3320253737fa52d89a3638b55e0a1d4884b45859736d893c096)

New to playing Farkle? Try playing with 1 dice! Each player takes 1 dice and rolls. Keep rolling until you get a 1, and you're safe. Last person to roll a 1 is the loser.

Want to play the full game? Here are all the [farkle rules](clc://clc/app-link/NodeSingle?nodeId=Announcement:72220b24d28534a9ff17afced8515e37fd226a69061f5c8217f329c7b18dd417)! May the odds be in your favor.

You're walking away with your own set but you can also [play on your phone](https://watermarkchurch.github.io/wm-contentful-ui-extensions/latest/farkle) too!

*Registration for the showcase is full but if you're interested in experiencing The Porch, you can still attend at 7:00 pm.*

The Porch challenges young adults to take the next step of faith and connect with others who will spur them on to full devotion to Christ. This ministry challenges young adults to put their faith into practice and serves as an introduction to participation in the local church.

[Roll a Dice](https://08unw.csb.app)

What‚Äôs so great about this silly game? We believe a team that plays together, stays together. Shared social experiences help team members become friends. Laughing together as a team builds intimacy. Learning to laugh at yourself builds humility. For us, the silliness of Farkle is serious business!

Don‚Äôt lose. There‚Äôs no winner in Farkle, only a loser.

### __THE CONSEQUENCE__
When we play, the loser gets a consequence. Before the game begins, players come up with an agreed upon consequence for the loser. Good consequences motivate player involvement and create tension in gameplay.

### __GAMEPLAY__
- On your turn, roll all six dice. Set aside dice worth points. This begins your running point total for that turn.
- Next, you may choose to roll the remaining dice, removing any dice worth points and adding them to your running point total.
- If you are ever able to set aside all six dice, you must re-roll all six dice at least once.
- If you are ever unable to set aside any dice (no dice rolled are worth points), you have ‚Äúfarkled out‚Äù of that turn. This means you lose your running point total for this turn, and your turn is over with no points.
- You may choose to end your turn at any time in order to keep the running point total that you‚Äôve accumulated on that turn.
- After you end your turn and pass the dice to the next player, record your running point total for that turn on the score sheet and add it to your score from previous rounds.

### __Scoring__  
There are many variations of Farkle scoring. Here‚Äôs how we play:
-   5‚Äôs = 50 points
-   1‚Äôs = 100 points
-   1,1,1 = 1,000 points
-   2,2,2 = 200 points
-   3,3,3 = 300 points
-   4,4,4 = 400 points
-   5,5,5 = 500 points
-   6,6,6 = 600 points
-   Straight of 1-6 = 1,500 points
*No special scoring for Four, Five, or Six of a Kind 
*Sample roll: 3-2-3-5-1-3=450 points

### __STRATEGY__  
You are not required to set aside ALL dice worth points. For example, if you roll a 1 and a 5, it may be strategic to set aside the 1 and roll the 5 again with the rest of the non-point dice. This strategy may give you a better chance of rolling a three of a kind. Remember, at least one die worth points must be set aside after each roll.

### __MINIMUM FIRST SCORE__  
To enter the game and begin recording points on the score sheet, you must reach at least 500 points in a single turn. When you reach 500 points for the first time, you may choose to immediately end your turn to prevent losing the points. It might take a few turns just to get on the score sheet!

### __ENDING THE GAME__  
When a player meets or exceeds 5,000 total points and ends their turn, each of the other players get one final turn to try to keep their score out of last place. The player with the next highest score rolls next. Repeat until all remaining players have one final turn. The player with the lowest total score is the loser.

### __THE PAYOFF__  
A good loser will execute their consequence quickly, thoroughly, and without complaining. If the end result is laughter and an unforgettable memory, you‚Äôre doing it right!

summary.en-US: Here's what you need to know for Tuesday.

description.en-US:
Friends ‚Äì

Through one of the craziest years, God has made it clear that the Church is unstoppable. Can you believe the Church Leaders Conference 2021 is finally here? We‚Äôve been waiting for this. Our team has been praying for each of you, for our time together, and we cannot wait to see what God is going to do over the next few days. Thank you for choosing to invest your time with us. It is going to be a blast!

Here are the details for this week:

__CLC APP:__
Way to go! You've found the go-to resource for schedule, maps, announcements, and everything you need for a great experience here at CLC. You can create a personalized schedule by saving the events you want to attend to the My CLC tab. Make sure you turn the notifications on so you don't miss a beat!

__PARKING:__¬†At Watermark, parking can be a bit of an‚Ä¶ opportunity to grow in patience. To best serve you and our midweek ministries, please consider walking if staying close, carpooling, or taking advantage of hotel shuttles. If driving, please let our volunteers guide you to the appropriate parking lots or the parking map on the Connect tab.

__CHECK-IN FOR MAIN CONFERENCE (TUESDAY, APRIL 27):__ Check-in for the general conference starts at 12 PM in the Town Center on Tuesday. Please check in by 12:30 PM before the conference kicks off at 1 PM. View the full schedule on the Schedule tab. 

__MEALS:__ Dinner on Tuesday and Wednesday and lunch on Wednesday are included in the price of your ticket. Lunch is also provided for Ministry Workshop attendees on Tuesday. If you are not attending a Ministry Workshop, you can buy lunch for $5 on Tuesday.

### FAQ
__WHAT DO I WEAR?:__ Dress casual and comfortable. In Texas, we love our air conditioning, so consider bringing a warmer layer each day. 

__IF I FIND MYSELF WITH SOME FREE TIME BEFORE OR AFTER THE CONFERENCE ‚Äì DO YOU HAVE ANY RECOMMENDATIONS?__ We‚Äôve put together a list of 54 Things To Do While You‚Äôre In Dallas on the Connect tab including local attractions, ideas for team activities, and recommended restaurants. Disclaimer: You‚Äôll regret skipping out on the conference meals. Trust us. 

__BUT WHAT ABOUT COVID-19?__ The best information we have suggests that we will be able to gather in-person in a safe and responsible way, much like how our church body is meeting each weekend. You can read our current guidelines and protocols [here](https://www.watermark.org/covid19update/dallas).
Uncover the best strategies for using social media, print media, on-stage announcements, and email to communicate with your church body.

Lunch will be provided for workshop attendees. If you are not attending a workshop, lunch will be available for purchase.

- ALL batter, fry oil (organic coconut oil) and ingredients of the sides are organic, gluten-free, dairy-free, soy-free, corn-free, peanut-free, and non-gmo.

internalTitle.en-US: 54 Things To Do While You‚Äôre in Dallas

title.en-US: 54 Things To Do While You‚Äôre in Dallas

summary.en-US: A few recommendations from our staff.

description.en-US:
#### Howdy and Welcome to Dallas!
Honestly, you probably won't hear too many "howdys" in Dallas, but maybe a few "y'alls" here and there. The CLC team would like to provide you with a little intro to Dallas, to help you and your team explore our city before or after the conference, or in the evenings. 

#### The Food
The first thing you need to know is that CLC lunches and dinners are worth staying for. Let‚Äôs just say that we have left a few popular spots off this list because they are coming to us.  

You have some great options for other times (perhaps a late night "Fourth Meal"?). Nearest to Watermark, you'll find [Mattito‚Äôs](http://www.mattitos.com/locations/forest-lane-dallas/), [Asian Mint](https://asianmint.com/asian-mint-at-75-forest-lane-dallas-tx/), Chipotle, and Street‚Äôs Chicken. You'll also find several choices at Walnut Hill and 75 including Taco Deli, Snooze, Bellagreen, and Unleaven Fresh Kitchen. For more great barbecue, try [Ten 50 BBQ](http://ten50bbq.com/) or [Babe‚Äôs Chicken](https://www.babeschicken.com/our-kitchens/carrollton/). If you are in the mood for a burger, then check out Liberty Burger or Shady‚Äôs Burger.

In need of breakfast? Nearby go-tos include [Original Pancake House](http://ophdfw.com/) and [Maple Leaf Diner](http://www.mldiner.com/) (it's Canadian!). [Cindi's New York Deli](http://cindisnydeli.com/) is a popular choice among Watermark staff. 

Trying to satisfy a sweet tooth? Try a Dallas staple, [Wild About Harry‚Äôs](https://www.wildaboutharrys.com/), for frozen custard.  Other local spots to check out are [Cinnaholic](https://locations.cinnaholic.com/ll/us/tx/richardson/100-s-central-expy-unit-15/) for gourmet cinnamon rolls and Steel City Pops. 

Dallas also has plenty of great places for quicker bites. You don't have to look far for a Chick-fil-A, Whataburger, Pot Belly Sandwich Shop, Sonic, In-N-Out, Freebirds, Waffle House, Raising Cane's, Dairy Queen, or even [Shake Shack ](https://www.shakeshack.com/location/addison-dallas-tx/). 

#### The Neighborhoods

LOTS of other eateries exist in the various neighborhoods around Dallas. 

[Trinity Groves](http://www.trinitygroves.com/), located in a majorly redeveloped portion of West Dallas, not only serves as a multi-eatery "restaurant incubator" with great patio dining, but it also offers a walking bridge and great views of Downtown Dallas. (Be sure to stop at [Kate Weiser Chocolate](https://kateweiserchocolate.com/), even if it's only to view her chocolate creations.) 

[Deep Ellum](http://deepellumtexas.com/) (east of Downtown) or [Bishop Arts](http://www.bishopartsdistrict.com/home) (southwest Dallas) are revitalized areas full of culture, shops, and food ‚Äì and are highly walkable. I'd personally give the edge to Bishop Arts, but Deep Ellum is edgier if that's your scene. If you want to explore a little bit closer in, spend some time on [Lower Greenville](http://neighborhoods.dmagazine.com/dallas/east-dallas/lower-greenville/) or wander [Mockingbird Station](http://www.mockingbirdstation.com/). 

#### Culture (or what Texans call, "The Learnin")

Highland Park is a city within a city ‚Äì located right in the heart of Dallas. Not only is it full of tree-lined streets and stylish shops, but HP is also home to [SMU](http://www.smu.edu/), one of the prettiest college campuses in this part of the world. Next to SMU you'll find the [George W. Bush Presidential Library](https://www.georgewbushlibrary.smu.edu/), one of Dallas's newest historical hot spots. 

The [Perot Museum of Nature and Science](https://www.perotmuseum.org/) is another new attraction with lots of buzz. And there's always the good ol' [Dallas Museum of Art](https://dma.org/), too (general admission is free, but you'll have to pay for parking). The [Sixth Floor Museum](http://www.jfk.org/) draws crowds as well, even 54 years after President Kennedy was assassinated from that very sixth floor (or was he?). 

Don't need education but would love to see something shiny? Consider the [Downtown GeO-Deck](http://reuniontower.com/), an observation deck inside that big ball you've noticed in the Dallas skyline (pro tip: it's called Reunion Tower). Or you can check out Jerry Jones's various Dallas Cowboys facilities: the mammoth [AT&T Stadium](http://attstadium.com/tours) out in Arlington, or the Cowboys training facility, [The Star](http://www.thestarinfrisco.com/tours), that's a little closer in. Both facilities offer tours. 

#### Team Time!

Catch a [Texas Rangers](https://www.mlb.com/rangers/schedule) game against the Angels Monday through Wednesday or Red Sox Thursday. More great team hangout options? [WhirlyBall](http://www.whirlyballplano.com/) in Plano is a fun combination of bumper cars and lacrosse. (They also offer laser tag if that's more your style.) Or you and your team can compete at [Top Golf](https://topgolf.com/us/dallas/), a high-tech driving range that's also great for non-golfers. 

For something free, scenic, and laid-back, consider Downtown's park-built-over-the-highway, [Klyde Warren Park ](https://www.klydewarrenpark.org/). They've got food trucks, restaurants, and lawn games.

Your crew could also try some indoor skydiving at [iFly](https://www.iflyworld.com/dallas/), or play video games at[ Dave & Busters](http://www.daveandbusters.com/dallas). If you prefer bowling ‚Äì go swanky at [Bowl & Barrel](http://www.bowlandbarrel.com/), or throw it back to middle school at [Strike & Reel](https://www.strikeandreel.com/), a large entertainment complex with bowling, games, movie theaters, and more! In need of a shopping fix? [NorthPark Center](https://www.northparkcenter.com/) is close to Watermark and a Dallas institution, but the [Galleria](http://www.galleriadallas.com/) is closer and offers ice skating. 

#### I Could Go On...

Wanna roam a giant bookstore? The [Half Price Books flagship store](https://www.hpb.com/001) is on Northwest Highway, just south of Watermark. Don't believe Dallas has nature? You'll find lots of it at [White Rock Lake](http://www.dallasparks.org/235/White-Rock-Lake) or the [Dallas Arboretum](http://www.dallasarboretum.org/). 

#### A Word about Transportation

Want to see some of these, but don't want to bother renting a car for a week? Check with the hotel to see how far their complementary shuttle will take you. Uber and Lyft also have a strong presence here in Dallas. Or if you're not in a hurry and want to enjoy the ride, Dallas's light-rail system (DART) can take you to several of the spots mentioned above. Plus, there are always cabs waiting right outside the hotels. 

Enjoy your time in Dallas! We're so glad you're here.

internalTitle.en-US: Helping Couples Survive an Affair - Breakout Session 2

description.en-US: An affair doesn‚Äôt have to be the end of a marriage or a family. The way we respond and minister to those in crisis matters. Gain both practical and biblical truths as you come alongside and help couples when trust has been broken.

We are committed to shepherding the flock the Lord has entrusted to our local body of Christ, specifically through biblical community. Our Community Shepherds (lay leaders) with staff (Community Directors) oversee, care for, and invest in small groups, primarily by communicating and developing relationships. Join us as the Elders encourage, train, and spur on our Community Shepherds.

For many churches, small groups are the entry point where people first experience biblical community, practice the ‚Äúone anothers‚Äù of Scripture, and begin the process of spiritual transformation. Learn Watermark's guiding principles for community, how to assimilate and form groups, strategies for training leaders, and how to ensure that Members are shepherding one another.

*Workshops require advance registration during conference signups.*
